name: Black Tassel
desc: An exceptionally powerful polearm that also offers a simple but elegant solution to the issue of the easily stained white tassel.

desc.text:
One night, a Millelith officer drank with a poet, and brought his signature white-tasseled halberd with him.
The poet's ink was spilled.
And the halberd's white tassel was dyed black.
"'Tis but a tale of polearm wielder and poet."
"Unrelated to mine own black-tasseled polearm."
The old smith smacked his apprentice.
He demanded that he dye the newly made polearm's tassel black.

customize.name: Zhongli
customize.desc: A mysterious expert contracted by the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. Extremely knowledgeable in all things.

customize.text: <color=#ffffff73>Equipping Zhongli with Black Tassel means giving up on</color> <color=#ffd780>DPS</color> <color=#ffffff73>. Therefore, it is only suitable for builds that utilize</color> <color=#ffd780>HP</color> <color=#ffffff73>and</color> <color=#ffd780>Shield-oriented</color> <color=#ffffff73>artifacts. The trade-off for sacrificing</color> <color=#ffd780>DMG</color> <color=#ffffff73>is a nearly impenetrable Shield. Combined with Zhongli's</color> <color=#ffd780>Elemental Skill CD</color> <color=#ffffff73>, the player can achieve near invincibility, thus becoming "solid as a rock."</color>

customize.name: Thoma
customize.desc: The Kamisato Clan's housekeeper. A well-known "fixer" in Inazuma.

customize.text: <color=#ffffff73>Thoma is a character that converts the largest amount of</color> <color=#ffd780>HP</color> <color=#ffffff73>into a</color> <color=#ffd780>Shield</color> <color=#ffffff73>. Since this weapon is suitable for providing a</color> <color=#ffd780>Shield</color> <color=#ffffff73>to Zhongli due to the boost in</color> <color=#ffd780>HP</color> <color=#ffffff73>from its sub-stats, it is also a suitable weapon for Thoma. However, the player must pay attention to his</color> <color=#ffd780>Energy Recharge</color> <color=#ffffff73>rate to cycle</color> <color=#ffd780>Elemental Burst DMG</color> <color=#ffffff73>and refresh his</color> <color=#ffd780>Shield</color> <color=#ffffff73>. While this weapon is equipped, the player must consider whether or not to equip</color> <color=#ffd780>Energy Recharge</color> <color=#ffffff73>based on the position of the hourglass.</color>

customize.name: Candace
customize.desc: A descendant of King Deshret with an amber left eye. The defender of Aaru Village.

customize.text: <color=#ffffff73>This weapon significantly increases</color> <color=#ffd780>HP</color> <color=#ffffff73>, which boosts Candace's</color> <color=#ffd780>DMG</color> <color=#ffffff73>. Since it is easy to obtain, it's worth considering as an intermediary weapon.</color>

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Grain of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
A black meteor once fell beyond Liyue's Sea of Clouds, said to have fallen to vanquish a monster. However, it was stained by powerful tainted blood, so this item no longer possesses the pure power of Rex Lapis.

materials.name: Fragile Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A bone shard once carried by a Geovishap.
Although they are quite fragile, they seem to still harbor some indescribable power.

materials.name: Firm Arrowhead
materials.desc: A roughly produced arrowhead. Though unimpressive, neither it nor the bow should be underestimated, for even the bravest knight can be felled by an arrow from the rear.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Piece of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Rumors of sea monsters are commonplace in Liyue, since the other shore is an unknown region that lies outside of Teyvat. Without the protection of The Seven, all that lies beyond is unknown chaos. Only power beyond the order of Teyvat is able to stain the power of Rex Lapis black.

materials.name: Fragile Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A bone shard once carried by a Geovishap.
Although they are quite fragile, they seem to still harbor some indescribable power.

materials.name: Firm Arrowhead
materials.desc: A roughly produced arrowhead. Though unimpressive, neither it nor the bow should be underestimated, for even the bravest knight can be felled by an arrow from the rear.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Piece of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Rumors of sea monsters are commonplace in Liyue, since the other shore is an unknown region that lies outside of Teyvat. Without the protection of The Seven, all that lies beyond is unknown chaos. Only power beyond the order of Teyvat is able to stain the power of Rex Lapis black.

materials.name: Sturdy Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A fragment of an unknown creature's bones that appear to be prized by Geovishaps for some reason.
The fragment appears to be quite aged. Despite being dragon-like beasts with no spoken language, they still seem to have some sort of special affection for these bone shards.

materials.name: Sharp Arrowhead
materials.desc: A well-made arrowhead. Sharp enough to penetrate armor with the ease of a rock through the surface of water.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Bit of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The coastal nations of Teyvat refer to the region beyond the protection of The Seven as the Dark Sea. It is said that many defeated gods refused to live under the new order of The Seven, so they fled to remote islands and became evil gods. However, their powers came from the same source as Rex Lapis, separate from this all-devouring darkness.

materials.name: Sturdy Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A fragment of an unknown creature's bones that appear to be prized by Geovishaps for some reason.
The fragment appears to be quite aged. Despite being dragon-like beasts with no spoken language, they still seem to have some sort of special affection for these bone shards.

materials.name: Sharp Arrowhead
materials.desc: A well-made arrowhead. Sharp enough to penetrate armor with the ease of a rock through the surface of water.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Bit of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The coastal nations of Teyvat refer to the region beyond the protection of The Seven as the Dark Sea. It is said that many defeated gods refused to live under the new order of The Seven, so they fled to remote islands and became evil gods. However, their powers came from the same source as Rex Lapis, separate from this all-devouring darkness.

materials.name: Fossilized Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A fossilized bone fragment sometimes found after defeating Geovishaps.
Geovishaps all dream of growing into great dragons one day. They see these fossils as dragon bones and greatly cherish them, perhaps because they too hope to attain the dragons' longevity and power.

materials.name: Weathered Arrowhead
materials.desc:
An old arrowhead coated in blood. The arrowhead has long since lost its sharpness and thus its use as a weapon.
However, it represents the pride of a hunter and acts as both an amulet and a medal.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Chunk of Aerosiderite
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
When Khaenri'ah was destroyed, a great sinner created endless monsters with dark, alien blood flowing through their veins. They rampaged across the land, destroying all in their paths. They were mutated lifeforms, and the mutations were caused by powers from beyond this world. The black serpentine dragon Durin that attacked Mondstadt was one such mutated being.

materials.name: Fossilized Bone Shard
materials.desc:
A fossilized bone fragment sometimes found after defeating Geovishaps.
Geovishaps all dream of growing into great dragons one day. They see these fossils as dragon bones and greatly cherish them, perhaps because they too hope to attain the dragons' longevity and power.
